Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan started their Super 4 journey in Asia Cup 2022 with a win against India by 5 wickets, pushing their NRR to +0.126 in the points table.
Afghanistan on the other hand started their Super 4 stage with a loss against Sri Lanka after remaining unbeaten in the group stage.
Mohammad Rizwan is currently the top scorer in the ongoing Asia Cup with 192 runs to his name in 3 matches, averaging 96 while striking at 128.00.

Babar Azam's form has been a concern for the team but the promotion of Mohammad Nawaz at #4 proved game-changing and the batting order looks stable with the likes of Fakhar Zaman, Khushdil Shah & Iftikhar Ahmed.
In the bowling department, Mohammad Nawaz has been the top wicket-taker with 7 wickets while vice-captain Shadab Khan has registered 6 wickets to his name in the tournament.
Afghanistan's key players include Rahmanullah Gurbaz, Ibrahim Zadran, and Hazratullah Zazai, who are in the top 10 run-getters.
Spinner Mujeeb Ur Rahman has been the top wicket-taker in the tournament with 7 wickets to his name.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was the 4th match of the Super 4 stage in Asia Cup 2022.
